translation: May I ask you a question?
transcript: 我问大家几个我自问自答的问题，啊？

translation: Do you have kids?
transcript: 你们有没有孩子吗？

translation: Please hands up if you do.
transcript: 有孩子的举手。

translation: There are some.
transcript: 哎哟不少了哈。

translation: Um, not really.
transcript: 啊，也不多哈。

translation: Do your kids love video games?
transcript: 呵呵，这个你们孩子打游戏吗？

translation: Please hands up if the answer is yes.
transcript: 你觉得你孩子打游戏的举手，喜欢打游戏的举手。

translation: Do you have any idea why they love video games?
transcript: 啊，你知道为什么他打游戏吗？

translation: Do you love video games?
transcript: 呵呵，你喜欢打游戏吗？

translation: No, I don’t.
transcript: 啊，不喜欢打游戏。

translation: I love it.
transcript: 我喜欢。

translation: I really love playing video games.
transcript: 我真的很喜欢打游戏。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为啥呢？

translation: I don’t know.
transcript: 我也不知道。

translation: I just love it.
transcript: 我就喜欢。

translation: I gradually figured out why after playing for a while.
transcript: 打多了，我就知道为啥了。

translation: The more you play, the deeper you get addicted to it.
transcript: 啊，这一打呢，就打上瘾了。

translation: It brings you to a whole new world.
transcript: 这一打呢，就打出了另外一个世界，打出了个灿烂的世界。

translation: One day, my son, my 16-year-old, eldest son said, “Dad, I feel depressed recently.”
transcript: 有一天，我儿子跟我说，我我儿子也挺大的了啊，我有一个大儿子啊，十六了，说：爸，我那个啧最近挺郁闷的。

translation: And I asked, “What’s wrong?”
transcript: 我说，咋啦？

translation: He said, “Mum keeps nagging me about being a ‘chair person’.”
transcript: 他说，老妈老老老老“得吧”我，说我整天在那儿当坐家。

translation: You see what I mean.
transcript: 你知道吧。

translation: Oops.
transcript: 完了。

translation: It’s about video games again.
transcript: 打游戏。

translation: I said, “Son, you are already 16 and will be a college student in a year or two.Just let your mother say whatever she likes, for it will not be long before you leave home.When you go to university, you will not be bothered by your mother’s daily mumbling.”
transcript: 我说，哎呦儿子啊，哎呀你看你今年都十六了，你马上要上大学嘞，也没几年了。你就让你妈“得吧”吧，你妈“得吧”你也没几年可“得吧”你了。啊，你再过两年一上大学就走啦就出去啦，呃也不在家住着啦，你妈想“得吧”你得不着了。

translation: My son immediately grasped the meaning and said, “Right, Dad is surely right.”
transcript: 哎呦，我儿子特懂事，一说：“哟是，老爸，你说的对”。

translation: Then he went to coax his mother.
transcript: 哎好，就回去哄他老妈去了。

translation: I felt sympathized with my son.
transcript: 我一想呢，哎哟，我挺理解啊我儿子的。

translation: So I went to talk with his mother.
transcript: 我就去跟他妈说。

translation: His mother complained, “He’s been sitting there all day long, playing games. He’s so immersed in it that he would ignore my repeated lunch-time reminder.”
transcript: 呃他妈呢就抱怨：“他就整天就坐那儿打游戏，啊，都不出来，啊吃饭要喊三回，啊！”

translation: And I asked, “My dear wife, let me ask you a few questions.”
transcript: 哎我说，孩儿他娘 ，孩儿子他娘啊！我说问你几个问题。

translation: Our Q&A was brief.
transcript: 我们的对话很简短。

translation: I asked, “How did our son perform in the high-school entrance exam?  ”
transcript: 我说：“你儿子中考班里考第几啊？”

translation: She answered, “He ranked No.1 in his class.”
transcript: 她说：“第一。”

translation: I asked again, “Which high school was he admitted to?”
transcript: 我说：“现在考到哪去了？”

translation: “Beijing No.4 High School.”
transcript: “北京四中。”

translation: A top high school in China.
transcript: 北京四中啊，全中国第一高校，啊。

translation: I continued to ask, “How does he perform there?”
transcript: 我说：“考到四中以后现在成绩怎么样？”

translation: She answered, “He’s done a pretty good job and is thoughtful, according to his teachers.”
transcript: 她说：“还不错呀！算是非常成熟的一个，这是老师的评价。”

translation: I thus said, “Then just let him play it as much as he wishes.”
transcript: 我说：“那你就让他打吧，打，打死为止啊！”

translation: How come my son loved video games so much?
transcript: 后来也是啊，为什么孩子喜欢打游戏？

translation: I needed to figure it out.
transcript: 我后来就想，哎呦！我要去琢磨琢磨。

translation: I asked my son if I could join him in playing games.
transcript: 我我就问我儿子说，老爸也想打一打，带我一块儿打行吗？我能干啥。

translation: He said, “Dad, you are forty now and you are kind of slow. Maybe you can do ‘energy transfusion’ like a ‘wet nurse’ behind me.”
transcript: 他说：“爸，你都四十几岁了，啊，反应比较慢，啊这样吧，我给你练个号，啊在后面当奶妈，补血。”

translation: Please hands up if you know what “energy transfusion” is.
transcript: 啊懂这个词儿的人举手。

translation: There are many.
transcript: 你看这么多。

translation: Good!
transcript: 哎哟，今天好！

translation: I thus followed him in the game, doing “energy transfusion”.
transcript: 啊，哗啊我就给他补血，在后面补血，猛点。

translation: One time I was one second slower and was “beaten" by his fellow classmates.
transcript: 稍点晚了一秒，就他们被他们的同学就扁一顿。

translation: Do you know what they said?
transcript: 你知道他同学说什么？

translation: They said how silly the “wet nurse” was.
transcript: 说那个奶妈怎么那么二呀。

translation: And my son responded, “Shut up. That’s my dad.”
transcript: 完了我儿子，你知道我儿子说什么？闭嘴shut up，那是我爹。

translation: Suddenly, his classmates went crazy.
transcript: 所有人都疯了。

translation: Wow!
transcript: 哇！

translation: Your dad’s cool.
transcript: 你还有这样的老爹。

translation: That made my son very proud of me and told them that his dad was the “wet nurse” doing “energy transfusion” for him.
transcript: 所以一下我在儿子的心目中啊，他欻他特自豪，跟同学说，我爸给我补血的，我爸是奶妈。

translation: I played the role of a psycho beauty, you see.
transcript: 我练了一个很变态的一个美女那个形象，你知道吗。

translation: Why?
transcript: 因为什么呢？

translation: Because no one would like to let you in unless you are a beauty.
transcript: 你不练成美女形象所有的组都不愿意组你。

translation: You see what I mean.
transcript: 对吧，谁谁组你啊。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为啥呢？

translation: I’d like to share my view here today.
transcript: 说一句不好听的，今天我给大家共享一下思想。

translation: Be it in virtual games or in reality, there’s not much that we can draw on to educate our children.
transcript: 不光是打游戏，我发现啊，我们现实生活中里面已经没有多少东西可以拿来让我们作为材料去教我们的孩子了。

translation: I was born in the 1960s and witnessed the Cultural Revolution with my parents’ generation.
transcript: 我是六十年代的人，我父母这一代经历了文化大革命。

translation: One lesson they learnt from the Cultural Revolution was that never trust anyone.
transcript: 你知道他们也学会了一件事儿，文化大革命教了他什么？告诉他，谁也不能信。

translation: That’s not something I’m supposed to pass it onto my son.
transcript: 我难道拿这些东西教儿子，儿子啊，谁也不能信啊。

translation: Nor will he believe it.
transcript: 我儿子说，您在说啥。

translation: He loves his buddies.
transcript: 我哥们儿挺好的呀。

translation: I’m not supposed to tell him that all business models in China are about the “last-minute” issue, we will just take whatever our foreign friends have come up with.
transcript: 难道我教他说，哎哟儿子，现在中国的所有的商业模式啊，都是最后一公里，老外有啥。

translation: Why bother innovating when you can copy?
transcript: 搬来就是啦，别创新啦，干嘛啊那么累？

translation: Am I supposed to tell him that, "Son, since you are on your own after college, maybe I should just send you to America now during vacations so that you could figure out what young Americans are into now and how things work there. Then you could come back with all that."
transcript: 你马上过完几年读完大学就要啧自己谋生啦，挣钱啦，啊琢磨琢磨；哎，我现在就把你送到美国去，寒假暑假去弄一弄，啊，看看美国有什么新鲜玩意儿，那边的九零后八零后都在干啥，你到时候抄回来。

translation: Should I say those to him?
transcript: 我难道教他这个？

translation: Is that positive influence?
transcript: 真的教他这个东西吗？

translation: Should I show him the dark side of society and tell him it’s all about connections?
transcript: 难道我去教他说，儿子现在社会上挺挺黑的啊，对吧，没这个，事情不好办，啊托关系？

translation: Am I supposed to educate him that way?
transcript: 难道我教他这个？

translation: I'm sorry to tell you this but our children know far more than we do.
transcript: 告诉大家，不好意思啊，现在的孩子啊，其实比我们懂，比我们懂的多。

translation: He told me that he knew the dark side of society more than I did.
transcript: 你说他社会黑暗，他说我知道啊，我比你知道的还多，我比你知道的还多。

translation: Am I supposed to tell him to pretend his father is a certain “Mr. Big”, not Mr. Xu?
transcript: 难道我告诉他说，唉，不要跟别人说你爸，老爸姓徐，告诉他叫李刚？

translation: Can I do that?
transcript: 能这样子教吗？

translation: Of course not.
transcript: 没了。

translation: We often brag about how much we have accomplished to the younger generation born in the 80s and 90s.
transcript: 我们整天跟八零后九零后的孩子吹牛皮。

translation: We believe China’s extraordinary achievements in the Reform and Opening-up and economic growth all owe to our generation.
transcript: 说什么，说中国的现代的改革开放也好，经济的成就是我们这两代人三代人搞出来的。

translation: And we have already surpassed Europe, the UK in particular and Japan, and is approaching the USA.
transcript: 我们牛，多牛，我们把当当当当当，啊，欧洲打败了，美国快了，日本过去啦，英国没戏啦。

translation: Is that something that I should brag about?
transcript: 我能跟他说这个？

translation: He once said to me, “Dad, indeed, many of your generation have made a big fortune; but they just seem busy with emigration.
transcript: 人家说一句了，他说爸，你们这一代人是挣了很多钱，好像现在整天移民的也是你们，啊。

translation: It has taken us over three decades to become rich, but it will probably take us over 100 years to curb environmental pollution.
transcript: 我们挣了三十年的钱，可能我们要花一百年，一百年把我们的环境再补回来。

translation: We have been busy accumulating wealth since the past three decades.
transcript: 我们挣了三十年的钱。

translation: However, China, the birthplace of Confucius and Mencius doctrine, has witnessed serious ethical fading.
transcript: 可是中国作为一个孔孟之道的国家，却成了世界上最没有道德底线的一个国家。

translation: Am I supposed to tell him that?
transcript: 我教他这些东西吗？

translation: It may take us two to three hundred years to raise our moral standard to due level.
transcript: 我们可能要花两百年三百年才能把我们的道德底线拉回来。

translation: Now I have a guilty conscience when it comes to parenting.
transcript: 我教他什么？所以我感到空虚。

translation: The funny thing is The Global Times enjoys a huge popularity among Chinese people.
transcript: 我现在都你看咱们中国人特有意思，特喜欢看《环球时报》啊。

translation: They may have some foreign friends as I do.
transcript: 年轻人啊，啊一看老外，我们这有一些老外的朋友，我也有很多老外朋友。

translation: But that does not impair their enthusiasm for The Global Times.
transcript: 一看老外，就看《环球时报》，看了《环球时报》又看老外。

translation: I don’t think we can educate our children well when we are so self-contradicted.
transcript: 我觉得这这个东西没法教孩子，你知道吗。

translation: It is not our children, but us that are to blame.
transcript: 我觉得现在真的不是孩子的错，是我们有问题。

translation: It is not they, but us that are silly.
transcript: 不是人家二，是我们有点二。

translation: In fact, many new terms today were invented by our children.
transcript: 所以 啧这个，而且现在很多名词啊，真的还真是我们的孩子创造出来的。

translation: For example, “holy shit”.
transcript: 比如谁知道“我勒个去”。

translation: What does “holy shit” mean?
transcript: “我勒个去”叫什么意思？

translation: I am not sure if writers of our generation understand it.
transcript: 啊，你看这个问题，是吧，这种问题，你说你作家吧，你说你是我知道还是不知道好。

translation: If they do, they’d better explain it.
transcript: 你说我知道，那你说了，解释解释。

translation: If not, I won’t feel surprised.
transcript: 你说我不知道，哎呀，难怪了。

translation: Anyway, there are stuff that we simply cannot tell them.
transcript: 所以社会上呢现在有很多问题，那我们没法教给孩子。

translation: When we were young, at least they could "brainwash" us with the mainstream ideology like "Follow Lei Feng's example".
transcript: 当年我们那一代，至少主流思想还可以把雷锋拿出来忽悠我们。

translation: When I attempted to educate my son with Uncle Lei Feng’s deeds, he just commented, “Cool! Lei Feng’s surely awesome.”
transcript: 我现在拿出拿，不是，向雷锋叔叔学习, 完了我儿子跟我说：“耶！好！酷！耶！雷锋。”

translation: I also have a 14-year-old daughter.
transcript: 我女儿十四岁。

translation: I once took her to the Disneyland.
transcript: 我带她去迪斯尼。

translation: I asked, “Hey, honey, do you like it?”
transcript: 我说：“女儿，你喜欢吗？”

translation: My daughter answered, “Do you want to hear the truth, dad?”
transcript: 完了我女儿说：“爸，你想听真话吗？”

translation: I said, "Yes, go ahead."
transcript: 我说：“你说吧。”

translation: Then she said, "The only reason we go to the Disneyland and play with Barbie dolls is that we want to do the things that you grown-ups suppose we will like. I can just fake a "wow" at Disneyland but inside I was like "eww".
transcript: 她说：“爸，真的去迪斯尼是陪你们这些老头老太太看的，我们都是这样，我们看芭比娃娃、看迪士尼，我们都说，哎呦！完了回来一转身说，哕。”

translation: She added, “To be frank, dad, this is my first and also the last trip to the Disneyland. It’s just so silly.”
transcript: 她说：“爸，说句良心话，这是第一次，也是我最后一次来迪斯尼了，太二了。”

translation: Can you expect my 14-year-old daughter to enjoy such dolls?
transcript: 你能指望我女儿十四岁回家弄一个啧这玩意吗？

translation: No way.
transcript: 不可能的事情。

translation: Kids today prefer something real.
transcript: 现在的孩子喜欢一些真实的东西。

translation: So let’s stop talking nonsense.
transcript: 不要跟他编瞎话了。

translation: People of our generation tend to be more hypocritical.
transcript: 我不说了嘛，咱们喜欢，咱们这一代人一说一打电话。

translation: For example, we may end a phone call by telling the caller we are at a conference and will call back later.
transcript: 哎，我在开会呢，回头再说吧。

translation: So hypocritical, aren’t we?
transcript: 虚伪不虚伪啊，啊？

translation: I hate to be disturbed by a call while I’m concentrating on something.
transcript: 我专心干一件事的时候，我就讨厌别人给我打电话了。

translation: Once, the moment I picked up a phone call, I directly said to the other side, “you know what, I’m busy playing games. Who the hell are you? ”
transcript: 有一次一个朋友打电话，我上来就来一句，你知道我在干嘛呢，我正在打游戏呢，我说哪个SB给我打电话呀？

translation: After I hanged up, I heard over headset my teammates urging others.
transcript: 完了我们军团的人在那那耳麦里头说，呀，谁谁谁啊。

translation: I told them I had to stop for a while and go out.
transcript: 我说等会儿啊，我这奶妈当不了啦，我这出去了。

translation: Then I called back. The caller just now turned out to be my father.
transcript: 完了一打电话，我爸。

translation: Seriously, no kidding.
transcript: 真的，我这不是讲笑话儿。

translation: I immediately turned to a much softer tone, “Hey, dad, I’ll call you back later. OK?”
transcript: 我爸，我马上改口了，我说我说，不是呃我说爸，一会我再给你打回来。

translation: Had it been someone else, I’d say, “I’m busy playing games. Bye.”
transcript: 换别人我早说了，我打游戏呢，回头再说吧。

translation: What makes video games so fascinating to kids?
transcript: 那你知道游戏里有啥吗？为什么这么多孩子喜欢打游戏？

translation: I can assure you that there are many brilliant ideas and visual feasts in those games.
transcript: 我告诉你，游戏里有一些很灿烂的东西，有视觉消费的盛宴。

translation: Why did so many Chinese movies fail?
transcript: 为什么很多国产电影不灵呢？

translation: Because they couldn’t even compare with games in terms of visual effect.
transcript: 那游戏比它好看。

translation: Honesty exists in games.
transcript: 游戏里有真诚。

translation: For example, my son’s classmates expect me online at 8:05 tonight.
transcript: 比如说，我儿子的同班同学，指望着今日晚上八点零五分奶妈到场。

translation: To live up to their expectation, I must show up on time.
transcript: 你说我敢不到场吗。

translation: Should you be in my position, could you fail your son by refusing their game invitation?
transcript: 你哪天你儿子，你你你你你的孩子打游戏你敢不到场吗？

translation: As a “wet nurse”, you must keep your word.
transcript: 假如你也是奶妈的话，这诚信度很高哒。

translation: In the world of video games, our territory may be grabbed, our home be burgled, and our fellowmen be killed.
transcript: 再有，那游戏里说，这是我的地盘被抢啦，我们家被盗啦，咣谁被砍啦。

translation: The next day, one single call from our team leader would unite us all to counterattack and kill them all. That’s it.
transcript: 那游戏第二天说，一号召，全军团的人一块上去，干了他，鸟了他，鸟死那个，啧，对不对。

translation: As the old saying goes, when fighting a battle, rely on your father and brothers.
transcript: 上阵亲兄弟，打架父子兵，倒过来说也可以啊！

translation: If I lose my territory in a game, I’m supposed to take it back immediately.
transcript: 我在游戏里面我丢失的地盘，我马上就要拿回来的。

translation: In reality, however, we haven’t taken any lost territory back over the past century.
transcript: 我们好像一百年丢失的国土没拿回来过什么。

translation: Have we?
transcript: 是吧？

translation: According to The Global Times, we may have taken a little back.
transcript: 我好像就是《环球时报》告诉我们拿回来一点。

translation: Isn't that ironic?
transcript: 可笑吧？

translation: What can we find in video games?
transcript: 所以我们要看看游戏里到底有啥？

translation: Passion, patriotism and democracy.
transcript: 有热血，有爱国，有民主。

translation: For example, parliamentary system is exercised in our team.
transcript: 嚯我们军团都是议会制，选举的，对吧。

translation: So, you can at least have a vote in a game, which is cool.
transcript: 所以啦，我告诉你打游戏你至少知道选谁，选得还挺爽，你知道吧。

translation: Video games are all-inclusive.
transcript: 游戏里很多东西。

translation: And this virtual world has one thing in common with real world, that is, basic cultural elements.
transcript: 游戏里还有一个东西跟现实生活中是一样的东西，是什么？是一些文化的基本的元素。

translation: China is now experiencing rapid cultural development, what have we achieve?
transcript: 比如说我们现在说文化大发展，中国现在眨眼之间成了什么？

translation: We are now the publisher who have issued most publications worldwide.
transcript: 成了全世界图书出版第一国家。

translation: Yet, you cannot find many world-renowned men of letters in current China.
transcript: 可是，中国有几个真正的大家？很少。

translation: There are many writers, though.
transcript: 作家很多，大家不多。

translation: By contrast, new terms keep emerging from the game world.
transcript: 而游戏里面却出了这么多的新名词儿，非常多的新名词儿。

translation: Those terms, I—Xu Ke assume, will become a starting point of China’s cultural rejuvenation.
transcript: 这些名词没准儿，我徐克今天只是提一个问题，提一个思考，哪天就成了未来中国文化复兴的一个起点，一个启蒙。

translation: I don’t wanna say too much today, for this topic can trigger endless discussions.
transcript: 我今天不想说太多，因为这个话呢可以展上的没多没完没了。

translation: We don’t have so much time.
transcript: 你看说着说着大家一晃就过去了。

translation: Now, with the new born coming to my family, I have three kids.
transcript: 完了我刚刚生了一个小孩儿，又生一个，第三个啦。

translation: Will the director please show the picture of my nine-month-old baby?
transcript: 哎请编导把图片播一下，九个月。

translation: Last week, I said to him, “Son, do learn from Uncle Lei Feng.”
transcript: 上个礼拜我跟他说，我说，儿子啊，我说这个向雷锋叔叔学习啊。

translation: Upon hearing that, my son replied, “Shut up!”
transcript: 我刚说完，我儿子：shut up。

translation: Just kidding.
transcript: 当然啦，开玩笑的。

translation: He is now only 9 months old. How can he say that?
transcript: 我儿子才九个月，怎么会说话呢？

translation: As a father of such a little kid, I recall the old saying in the Three Character Classic that “man on earth, good at birth.”
transcript: 只是面对这么一个小孩，作为父亲，我想起了咱们一句古话，三字经的箴言：人之初、性本善。

translation: I ask myself, “What should I bring to such an innocent kid?”
transcript: 面对这么一个天真的孩子，我到底要教他啥，给他啥？

translation: Just stay true to my conscience and I will surely do good parenting.
transcript: 我要扪着良心，我一定会把我的孩子教好。

translation: Thank you all.
transcript: 谢谢大家。
